column4: I've got the nvidia module loaded, but xorg keeps failing with "nvidia" (module does not exist, 0)
pastebin /var/log/Xorg.0.log
go to a pastebin and paste the text in the /var/log/X0rg.0.log file
or you can just upload it from the page at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/48014/
were you able to view my pastebin url ?
hang on
sorry...no rush. "nv" driver okay for now.
try sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new
more info here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
it may help to mention that I'm running the 2.6.17-11 image...not 2.6.22
another alternative would be to remove all nvidia related packages and build it by running the install script directly from nvidia's home apge
i'm cool with that, but won't i need sources for 2.6.17-11 installed on my Gutsy?
yup, if you compile it you will need the headers
can i apt-get those?
yup
apt-cache search `uname -r` headers
i'd suggest putting some effort into getting ti working with packages first
there are a number of issue in connection with running your own build inclusing having to rebuild the module each time you upgrade kernel
have you done a sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new ?
yea..it's downloading the 2.6.22 kernel image at the moment
btw disabling usb keyboard/mouse in your bios might remove your boot issue :)

I'm going to go to sleep pretty soon... please focus on getting the precompiled modules to work for you first unless you are comfortable compiling and disabling specific modules from the modprobe sequence
if I disable USB support, I actually get to a splash-screen but it still hangs.
